title: McCarthy delivers in debut, leads Vikings' rally
content: In thrilling fashion Monday night, Minnesota quarterback J.J. McCarthy authored a late comeback, becoming the first quarterback in NFL history to account for three touchdowns in the fourth quarter of his NFL debut, as the Vikings outlasted the Bears.

title: 49ers' Kittle out weeks; Purdy could miss Week 2
content: The 49ers will be without star tight end George Kittle for multiple weeks due to a hamstring injury, while Brock Purdy might need to sit out Week 2 after hurting a shoulder and toe in the team's Week 1 win in Seattle.

title: Sources: Jaguars send Bigsby to Eagles for picks
content: The Jacksonville Jaguars are trading running back Tank Bigsby, who had five carries for 12 yards Sunday in a win over the Carolina Panthers, to the Philadelphia Eagles in exchange for 2026 fifth- and sixth-round picks, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Dodgers just miss no-hitter again; Glasnow stars
content: Tyler Glasnow, who struck out 11 and walked two on 105 pitches in his first career start against Colorado, combined with the Los Angeles Dodgers bullpen to one-hit the Rockies in a 3-1 win Monday night, as the veteran starter improved to 2-3 this season.

title: Bears rue opportunity lost in Johnson's debut
content: In Chicago's first regular-season game under coach Ben Johnson, Caleb Williams and the Bears saw a second-half lead slip in a 27-24 loss on Monday to the division rival Minnesota Vikings at Soldier Field, a contest the hosts led 17-6 in the third quarter.

title: Gators' Bett apologizes for spitting at opponent
content: Florida defensive tackle Brendan Bett apologized Monday for spitting at a USF player during a crucial moment in an 18-16 loss last weekend, calling his actions a "terrible mistake."

title: Sister of Wolves' Reid allegedly slain by boyfriend
content: The sister of Timberwolves player Naz Reid was fatally shot at a New Jersey apartment complex, and her boyfriend has been charged with murder.

title: Ex-Fins CB says Colts forced Tua into 'panic mode'
content: Former Dolphins and current Colts corner Xavien Howard said the game plan Sunday was to take away QB Tua Tagovailoa's first read and get him into "panic mode."

title: ‚úç NFL trade grades: Who won Bigsby deal?
content: The Eagles added some running back depth behind Saquon Barkley, but did they give up too much for Bigsby? We sized up the deal from both sides.

title: Real or not? 14 contenders, 14 reasons they can -- or can't? -- win the World Series
content: Lack of power? Bullpen holes? Injured stars? Why each contender's biggest weakness will -- or won't -- sink them in October.

title: Three young arms are here to carry the Mets into October
content: The rookie trio of Nolan McLean, Jonah Tong and Brandon Sproat looks to lift New York's fortunes this season.

title: Questions, takeaways off every NFL Week 1 game: Can Josh Allen overcome any obstacle? What can J.J. McCarthy do for an encore?
content: NFL Nation reporters react to all the action, answering the biggest questions coming out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 1.

title: Let's overreact to NFL Week 1: Which QB situations are most messy?
content: Will Jaxson Dart take Russell Wilson's job soon? Are the Dolphins doomed? We sized up Week 1 overreactions.

title: Ranking first-year WNBA coaches who have beaten -- or fallen short of -- expectations
content: Natalie Nakase has the Valkyries playoff-bound. Here's how all seven first-time WNBA head coaches have done.

title: As Carlos Alcaraz wins another US Open, can anyone challenge these Big Two?
content: With the past eight major titles, Alcaraz and Sinner are clearly dominant. Can anyone compete with them?

title: What is real -- and what isn't -- from NFL Week 1: Barnwell on the Lions, Colts, Dolphins and Jets
content: Let's size up the legitimacy of the Lions' offensive woes, two run-game surges, Aaron Rodgers' big day and the Dolphins' ineptitude in Week 1.

title: Week 1 fantasy football winners and losers and injury impacts from Sunday
content: A summary of Week 1's best and worst fantasy performances, biggest storylines and historical perspective.

title: NFL Week 1's top performance? Check the fan-voted 'Himmy' Award leaderboard
content: Fans weighed in on Week 1's top players, casting their votes for the 'Himmy' Award between Josh Allen, Aaron Rodgers, Emeka Egbuka and Daniel Jones.

title: Nine months to the World Cup: Does Pochettino know his best XI?
content: If Pochettino doesn't know his USMNT XI, is he willing to commit to one soon before he runs out of time ahead of the World Cup?

title: One year after Canada's Olympics cheating scandal, the once-renowned program moves on
content: It's been about a year since Canada was accused of cheating at the Olympics. With a new coach and lofty goals for the 2027 Women's World Cup, players are still trying to move on.

title: Mike Tyson to return to stage with 'Return of the Mike' one-man show
content: Tyson will perform in four cities prior to his exhibition fight with Floyd Mayweather Jr. next spring.

title: Canelo Alvarez vs. Terence Crawford: All you need to know about Saturday's fight
content: Andreas Hale explains why Canelo Alvarez and Terence Crawford are fighting, what it means for boxing and more.

title: How McLaren is managing Norris, Piastri ahead of final stretch in championship
content: From Hungary 2024 to Monza 2025, here's how McLaren has navigated team orders and tension between title-chasing teammates Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri.

title: True or false? What we think we know about SEC QBs, the Big 12, Oregon and more
content: The start of the 2025 season has been a delightful mess. Bill Connelly tries to make sense of what we've seen.

title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes from Kiper, Miller and Reid: Early concerns around top QBs?
content: John Mateer rising? Questions around LaNorris Sellers and Cade Klubnik? We have updates on NFL draft prospects through CFB Week 2.

title: Betting buzz: Sunday under-whelming for sportsbooks, bettors
content: The Jets-Steelers game was the exception in the NFL on Sunday when almost every game went under the point total.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool's Federico Chiesa linked to Turkey move
content: Besiktas have made an approach for Liverpool's Federico Chiesa. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Watch: Protesters torch Nepal PM Oli‚Äôs private home; storm, vandalise president's residence
content: Protests in Nepal escalated, resulting in vandalism at the residences of President Poudel and KP Sharma Oli, alongside the torching of the Nepali Congress party office. Demonstrators are demanding accountability for fatalities during protests against the government's social media ban, which has now been reversed.

title: Watch: PM Modi conducts aerial survey in flood-hit Himachal; to visit Punjab next
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi surveyed flood-ravaged areas in Himachal Pradesh, including Mandi and Kullu, following heavy monsoon rains. He then proceeded to Punjab for a similar assessment. Review meetings were held with officials and affected residents in both states, addressing the devastation and coordinating relief efforts. The floods have caused significant fatalities and displacement in both regions.

title: Google tightens AI use: Coders face strict rules; external tools prohibited
content: Google is mandating its software engineers to exclusively use internal AI models for coding, driven by CEO Sundar Pichai's call for AI adoption to maintain competitiveness. Employees are expected to demonstrate AI proficiency, potentially influencing performance reviews and career advancement.

title: Delhi CM Secretariat, Maulana Azad Medical College get bomb threat
content: A bomb threat email targeted Delhi's Chief Minister's Secretariat and Maulana Azad Medical College, prompting immediate responses. Fire tenders and bomb disposal squads were dispatched to both locations for thorough anti-sabotage checks. Authorities are investigating the email's origin, suspecting it may have been misdirected, but are treating the threat with utmost seriousness, ensuring public safety and security.

title: Sparks already flying! Why India and Pak skippers weren't seated together at Asia Cup presser
content: In Dubai, organisers strategically placed Afghanistan's Rashid Khan between India's Suryakumar Yadav and Pakistan's Salman Ali Agha at the Asia Cup 2025 press conference. Yadav emphasized the importance of aggression for victory, while Agha left emotional regulation to his players. India, aiming for their ninth title, will face Pakistan on September 14.

title: GST overhaul: Govt permits revised MRPs on unsold stock; old packaging allowed till Dec
content: The government has granted packaged goods manufacturers permission to print revised MRPs on unsold stock following the new GST rules, allowing them to use existing packaging until December. This decision addresses industry concerns about potential waste of packaging material worth over Rs 2,000 crore.

title: iPhone 17 launch event today: How, when and where to watch; expected devices
content: Apple's "Awe Dropping" event on September 9, 2025, is set to unveil the iPhone 17 series, including the rumored iPhone 17 Air, replacing the Plus model. Anticipate upgrades to the Apple Watch, potentially introducing the Ultra 3 with enhanced features, and a redesigned AirPods Pro 3 with a new H3 chip.

title: Allu Arjun‚Äôs Business Park flagged for illegal construction; GHMC issues notice
content: Icon Star Allu Arjun's family faces legal trouble as the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) issued a notice regarding illegal construction at Allu Business Park in Jubilee Hills. The GHMC alleges unauthorized extensions on the fourth floor, violating the sanctioned plan. Deputy Commissioner Sammaiah has ordered an inquiry into the matter.

title: Asia Cup: Surya warns Pakistan; drops hints of aggression on September 14
content: Suryakumar Yadav, India's captain, has issued a confident warning to Pakistan ahead of their Asia Cup clash, emphasizing the team's inherent aggression on the field. He acknowledged the long gap since India's last T20I but expressed confidence in the team's preparation and adaptability.

title: Mark Zuckerberg sues Meta over repeated account suspensions
content: An Indiana bankruptcy lawyer, Mark Zuckerberg, is suing Meta due to repeated account suspensions on Facebook. The platform consistently mistook him for the tech CEO, causing disruptions to his business and client communications. He seeks compensation for lost advertising funds and legal fees, highlighting the challenges of sharing a name with a famous figure in the digital age.

title: Nepal protest: Manisha Koirala breaks her silence; calls it a ‚ÄòBlack Day'
content: Bollywood actress Manisha Koirala has expressed her heartbreak over the violent protests erupting in Nepal after the government banned several social media platforms. Koirala, a native of Kathmandu, called it a 'black day' as security forces responded with gunfire to demonstrations against the ban on platforms like Facebook and YouTube.

title: Blow for Indian IT? Trump admin‚Äôs HIRE Act sends jitters; tax on overseas jobs likely
content: A proposed US bill, the HIRE Act, threatens Indian IT firms with a 25% tax on outsourced services, potentially eroding their competitive edge. This legislative move, coupled with existing market pressures, could force Indian companies to seek growth beyond the US and impact new contract acquisitions. The bill raises concerns about increased costs and reduced demand for IT services.

title: Elon Musk blends science and philosophy with a question on reality
content: Tech mogul Elon Musk's recent philosophical post on the nature of reality has sparked widespread interest. His ventures like SpaceX and Neuralink, pushing the boundaries of human existence, frame his inquiry. Musk's reflection came amidst progress in Mars landing simulations and his growing political influence.

title: Asia Cup: India the favourites? Pakistan captain Salman Agha says 'not really'
content: Pakistan captain Salman Agha has given his fast bowlers the green light to be aggressive during the Asia Cup, emphasizing that aggression is inherent to their game. He stressed the importance of playing good cricket and aiming to win the tournament. Agha acknowledged India's strong Asia Cup record but believes any team can win in T20 cricket.

title: Kia India passes full GST benefit: Model-wise savings up to Rs 4.48 lakh
content: Kia India will extend the full benefit of the recent GST reduction to customers on its ICE portfolio, effective September 22, 2025. The price cuts vary by model, with the Sonet seeing a reduction of up to Rs 1.64 lakh and the Carnival getting the biggest slash of Rs 4.48 lakh.

title: Maratha quota row: Jarange warns of blocking Mumbai milk supply; Dasara plans announced
content: Manoj Jarange, a quota activist, returned to his village after a hunger strike, warning the government to meet Maratha reservation demands by September 17. He threatened to halt milk and vegetable supplies to Mumbai if the government fails to distribute Kunbi caste certificates to Marathas in Marathwada based on the Hyderabad Gazette.

title: Dhanashree Verma gives out a strong message for women post divorce with Yuzvendra Chahal
content: Dhanashree Verma and Yuzvendra Chahal finalized their divorce earlier this year, aiming for a swift resolution before the IPL season. Dhanashree, now part of 'Rise And Fall,' shared her message of resilience for women post-divorce, emphasizing the importance of continuing to work hard and inspiring others to move forward with strength.

title: Bow wow! Stray dogs corner bike thieves, cops swoop in; 40 stolen motorcycles recovered
content: A gang of vehicle thieves, responsible for stealing over 40 motorcycles in Lucknow, were apprehended thanks to an unexpected intervention. During a police chase near Kudiya Ghat, a pack of stray dogs blocked the criminals' escape route, forcing them into a dead end where police were waiting.

title: Asia Cup selection puzzle: Samson or Jitesh? 'All depends on Gill's batting position'
content: With Shubman Gill returning as T20I vice-captain, the management is certain to prefer a Gill - Abhishek Sharma opening combination. In that case, Sanju Samson may have to give up his opening role. But is that the right call? Or should the management continue with the Samson - Abhishek pairing?

title: Rs 14k‚Äì16k cr scheme in works to cut construction gear import reliance
content: The Indian government is planning a Rs 14,000-16,000 crore scheme to boost domestic manufacturing of essential construction equipment. This initiative aims to reduce India's dependence on imports, particularly from China, Japan, South Korea, and Germany, and strengthen the infrastructure supply chain.

title: 'The Conjuring: Last Rites‚Äô: Loud narration during screening sparks fight; techie, his wife thrashed
content: A Chinchwad multiplex screening of 'The Conjuring: Last Rites' turned violent when a techie's request for a man to stop narrating the movie escalated into a physical altercation. The techie and his wife were allegedly attacked by the man and his wife after the techie politely asked them to stop spoiling the movie.

title: 'They are fit': No decision yet on Rohit, Virat for India A matches
content: India A are set to play three List A matches against Australia A and the TimesofIndia.com has learnt that both Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli will not be forced to play in the series and their participation. If at all it happens, it will only happen if they need game time before the tour of Australia, where the Men in Blue will play three ODIs.

title: Vikings‚Äô win soured: O‚ÄôConnell updates on Cashman, Okudah; injury worries mount
content: Despite a thrilling 27-24 comeback victory against the Chicago Bears, the Minnesota Vikings are facing injury concerns. Linebacker Blake Cashman suffered a hamstring injury, the severity of which is currently unknown and requires an MRI. Cornerback Jeff Okudah is also undergoing concussion protocol after a potential head injury during the game's final play.

title: US Open: Alcaraz earned $5 million prize money; tax will take away large chunk
content: Carlos Alcaraz clinched his second US Open title, defeating Jannik Sinner and securing a record $5 million prize. Despite the historic payout, US tax regulations will significantly reduce Alcaraz's earnings, potentially leaving him with around $2.5 million after federal and state taxes. A tax treaty with Spain offers some relief from double taxation.

title: 'Won't end well': Navarro's new warning to India over tariffs; takes 'Maharaja' jibe again
content: Former Trump advisor Peter Navarro has again criticized India's trade policies, labeling it the "Maharaja" of tariffs and warning of negative consequences if it aligns with Russia and China. He accused India of profiting from Russian oil and indirectly funding the Ukraine war.

title: Gold rate today: Gold prices climb to lifetime high; cross Rs 1.10 lakh/10 gms
content: Gold prices soared to a lifetime high on Monday, surpassing Rs 1.10 lakh per 10 grams, driven by a weakening US dollar and anticipation of Federal Reserve interest rate reductions. The surge, fueled by disappointing US labor market data, pushed international gold futures to unprecedented levels.

title: Big blow: D Gukesh's biggest defeat? How American GM aced the battle of youngest chess icons
content: Mishra, born in New Jersey to Indian parents, had already carved his place in history as the youngest-ever to earn the GM title at 12 years and four months. With this win, he set another record, becoming the youngest to defeat a reigning world champion in classical chess, eclipsing Gata Kamsky‚Äôs 1992 mark at 18, when he beat Garry Kasparov.

title: SSC warning: Paper sharing, discussions barred under new Act; non-bailable offence
content: The Staff Selection Commission (SSC) has cautioned candidates against sharing or discussing exam papers online, citing the Public Examinations Act, 2024. This law criminalizes unauthorized access and dissemination of exam content, with strict penalties including imprisonment and hefty fines. Aspirants, coaching centers, and digital platforms are urged to comply to maintain examination integrity.

title: Impostor in naval uniform: Guard duped; Rifle, 40 rounds vanish
content: A security breach occurred in Mumbai's Navy Nagar. An unidentified man impersonating a naval officer stole an INSAS rifle. He also took two magazines with 40 live cartridges. The incident happened last Saturday. Cuffe Parade police registered a theft case. Multiple agencies like NIA and ATS are investigating. The Navy has initiated a search and inquiry.

title: 'Too much at stake': USIBC lauds PM Modi, Trump's remarks; urges solving tariff row
content: The US‚ÄìIndia Business Council urged both governments to resolve trade differences through respectful dialogue, emphasizing the strong US-India partnership amid global uncertainty. Hailing the recent positive remarks from President Trump and Prime Minister Modi, USIBC stressed the need for an ambitious trade deal to restore investor confidence and boost prosperity.

title: A sketch, signature & more: What‚Äôs in Donald Trump‚Äôs alleged letter to Epstein?
content: House Democrats released a sexually suggestive letter, purportedly from Donald Trump to Jeffrey Epstein in 2003, reigniting scrutiny of their past ties. Trump had denied authoring the note and drawing, dismissing it as false. The release coincides with congressional pressure for transparency on Epstein-related documents, as lawmakers seek further investigation into the matter.

title: Rupert Murdoch succession battle: Eldest son Lachlan to control media empire
content: Rupert Murdoch's family has finalized a succession plan, ensuring Lachlan Murdoch's control over Fox Corp. until 2050. This arrangement, settling a dispute reminiscent of HBO's "Succession," grants Lachlan, along with his sisters Grace and Chloe, control of Fox News. Prudence MacLeod, Elisabeth Murdoch, and James Murdoch relinquished their claims for $3.

title: Sanjay Dutt cried 3 hrs after cancer diagnosis: Rakesh Roshan arranged treatment
content: Sanjay Dutt, the Bollywood icon, bravely confronted a cancer diagnosis during the lockdown, a period he initially struggled to process. Overwhelmed, he cried, thinking of his family, but resolved to fight. With family support and guidance from Rakesh Roshan, he underwent treatment, astonishingly cycling and playing badminton post-chemo. By October 2020, Dutt announced he was cancer-free, crediting his resilience.

title: Accused in Trump assassination attempt grills jurors with strange questions
content: The trial of Ryan Routh, accused of attempting to assassinate Donald Trump, commenced chaotically in West Palm Beach. Routh, representing himself, faced Judge Aileen Cannon's reprimand for irrelevant jury selection questions. He cited witness unavailability, including a Costa Rica-based ex-colleague fearing arrest. Routh also voiced jail condition complaints, which were dismissed. Facing charges like attempted assassination and firearms violations, Routh pleaded not guilty.

title: Asia Cup 2025 prize money: From Champions to runners-up ‚Äì who will earn how much
content: Eight teams will be vying for the coveted trophy this year. India, Pakistan, Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, and Afghanistan have gained direct entry. They will be joined by UAE, Oman, and Hong Kong, who secured their spots by finishing as the top three sides in the ACC Premier Cup for associate nations.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 24,850; Sensex up over 300 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Tuesday on positive global cues. While Nifty50 was above 24,850, BSE Sensex was up over 300 points.

title: Nostalgia: DK calls Dhoni 'hero'; recalls comparisons with Sobers
content: Dinesh Karthik recalls MS Dhoni‚Äôs breakthrough during an ‚ÄòA‚Äô series in Kenya, where his explosive power-hitting drew comparisons to Gary Sobers. With Rahul Dravid stepping back from wicketkeeping, Karthik briefly filled in before Dhoni took charge. ‚ÄúThe lead role was always meant for him,‚Äù Karthik said, describing how Dhoni‚Äôs arrival quickly swept Indian cricket off its feet.

title: Who is JJ McCarthy‚Äôs fianc√©e Katya Kuropas? All about the Vikings QB‚Äôs longtime love
content: Minnesota Vikings' rookie J.J. McCarthy is set for his NFL debut against the Chicago Bears, marking a pivotal moment for the franchise and the player. Off the field, McCarthy's personal life is flourishing. He is engaged to his high school sweetheart, Katya Kuropas, and they are expecting their first child in September.

title: Top stocks to buy : Recommendations for September 9- check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Somil Mehta of Mirae Asset Sharekhan recommends buying Apl Apollo Tubes Ltd, anticipating an uptrend after a flag pattern breakout, with targets set at Rs 1790. CDSL is also recommended for purchase, following a bullish consolidation breakout, aiming for a target of Rs 1670, as it resumes its upward trajectory.

title: Luxury overload: Rs 20 crore on the wrist; Pandya's watch worth more than Asia Cup prize money
content: Hardik Pandya grabbed attention at the Asia Cup training by wearing a Richard Mille RM 27-04 watch, estimated at Rs 20 crore. This rare timepiece, one of only 50 made in collaboration with Rafael Nadal, overshadows the tournament's prize money. Team India, led by Suryakumar Yadav, will begin their campaign on September 10.

title: "What Is Trump Hiding?" Democrats Question Signed Birthday Note To Epstein
content: US President Donald Trump is facing criticism after a lewd note allegedly written by him to serial sex offender Jeffrey Epstein in 2003 surfaced online.

title: Karisma Kapoor's Children Move Delhi High Court Over Sunjay Kapur Estate Dispute
content: In a fresh development in the battle over late industrialist Sunjay Kapur's approximately Rs 30,000 crore estate, his two children from his marriage with actor Karisma Kapoor have approached the Delhi High Court seeking their rightful share.

title: Vice President Election Live Updates: PM, Sonia Gandhi, Other Leaders Cast Votes, Counting To Begin At 6 PM
content: Vice Presidential Election 2025 Live Updates: Parliamentarians will choose between NDA's CP Radhakrishnan and the Opposition's B Sudershan Reddy for the post of Vice President today.

title: Opinion: Opinion | A $1.5 Billion Lesson: Why An AI Firm Is On The Verge Of Destroying Its Data
content: The Anthropic settlement marks a turning point. For the first time, an AI company has acknowledged - through its willingness to pay a historic settlement - that copyright holders deserve meaningful compensation.

title: Priti Adani Urges Global Philanthropists To Act As Co-Builders Of Change
content: Addressing a packed audience at the Asian Venture Philanthropy Network summit in Hong Kong, Dr Priti Adani delivered a stirring call for philanthropy to move beyond charity and become a  collaborative mission rooted in responsibility.

title: Japan's Ruling Liberal Democratic Party To Pick New PM On October 4
content: Japan's ruling Liberal Democratic Party (LDP) will pick its new leader on October 4, the party's election committee said Tuesday, replacing Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba who resigned after huge election setbacks.

title: "Not Possible To Stand With Government": Nepal Ministers Quit Amid Protests
content: Nepal Minister Prithvi Subba Gurung on Tuesday said Prime Minister K P Sharma Oli will not resign, even as massive protests continued to rock Kathmandu for a second consecutive day, and a few ministers so far pulled out from the Cabinet.

title: 'Gen Z', Often Mocked On LinkedIn, Gets Image Makeover In Nepal Protests
content: Till a few days back, 'Gen Z' was a term widely used in LinkedIn posts to take swipes at young individuals who, a section of Millennials claimed, were too individualistic and carefree to be good employees

title: Tagged "Arrogant", "Rigid", 'Gen Z' Brings Government To Knees In Nepal
content: Till a few days back, 'Gen Z' was a term widely used in LinkedIn posts to take swipes at young individuals who, a section of Millennials claimed, were too individualistic and carefree to be good employees

title: Nepal Protest Live Updates: PM K P Sharma Oli Resigns As Kathmandu Remains On The Boil
content: Nepal Gen-Z Protest LIVE Updates: Nepal Prime Minister K P Sharma Oli resigned on Tuesday, as hundreds of people stormed his office and private residence in Kathmandu during a massive agitation against corruption,

title: NDTV Profit GST Conclave Live Updates: Nirmala Sitharaman, Piyush Goyal To Speak On GST 2.0
content: The conclave will focus on discussions around GST 2.0 - the reform powering a Viksit Bharat with speakers including Union Minister of Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal, and Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran.

title: "Why Isn't KP Oli Resigning?" Nepal Ground Report Captures Anger On Streets
content: Nepal continued to witness anti-government sloganeering, marches on the street, stone-pelting, and massive vandalism by angry protesters on Tuesday.

title: Nepal PM, President's Houses Set On Fire As Protests Explode
content: Nepal Gen Z Protest News: Massive protests in Nepal today pushed the KP Sharma Oli government to the brink as Gen Z protesters took to arson and vandalism in various parts of the tiny Himalayan nation.

title: All About India's Longest Cantilever Glass Bridge, Set To Be Opened In Andhra
content: The glass bridge will become a new landmark for Visakhapatnam and attract tourists from all across India when it opens to the public on September 25.

title: Nepal To Pakistan, Protests And Unrest In India's Neighbouring Countries
content: India's neighbours have faced major political unrest in recent years, with protests and uprisings challenging their governments.

title: Thinnest iPhone To Apple Watch Series 11: What To Expect From Apple Event
content: Apple is expected to launch the iPhone 17 lineup along with a host of other devices at its event today.

title: Voting Underway For Vice President Polls, Congress Rakes Up 'Telugu' Angle
content: India will welcome a new Vice President by nightfall September 9. But will it be the BJP-led ruling alliance's pick of Maharashtra Governor CP Radhakrishnan? Or will the INDIA bloc's ex-Supreme Court judge, Justice B Sudershan Reddy, deliver a shock?

title: Opinion: Opinion: Don't Want To Be A Peasant? Try Thematic Investing
content: Youve got five more years  maybe less. In a fast-changing world turbocharged by President Donald Trumps executive orders and AI, people need to make investments that can transform their lives, or risk being left behind.

title: On Camera, Nepal Gen Z Protestors Enter President's House, Damage Portraits
content: Gen Z protestors took to the streets in Nepal on Monday, demanding that the PM KP Sharma Oli-led government lift its ban on social media platforms and end corruption.

title: Jaipur Labourers Can Now Sign Their Names, Thanks To NREGA Akhar Campaign
content: Under "NREGA Akhar Campaign", Jaipur district administration is teaching labourers to sign their names and providing them with basic numerical education.

title: ED questions BJP worker who filed petition in HC questioning Rahul Gandhi's citizenship
content: S. Vignesh Shishir said before entering the ED office that he has been summoned under section 37 of the Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA) with regard to the said investigation.

title: Shivamogga: Video of pro-Pakistan slogans goes viral, Bhadravathi police book case
content: The residents of Bhadravathi took out an Id-Milad procession in the town on September 8, and it is said that the video clip was shot during the procession.

title: Prohibitory orders extended in Maddur, security beefed up amid call for bandh
content: About 800 police personnel led by four officials of the rank of Superintendent of Police, three officials of the rank of Additional Superintendent of Police, besides fifteen Deputy Superintendents and thirty Inspectors of Police are manning the town.

title: Over 500 people in Kerala‚Äôs Wayanad fall victim to ‚Äòmule account‚Äô scam
content: Fraudsters from outside the district rent local residents' bank accounts for money and misuse these for illicit transactions and other illegal activities, say investigators

title: Delhi CM Secretariat, Maulana Azad Medical College get bomb threat
content: According to the Delhi Fire Service (DFS), a separate call regarding the threat was also received, following which multiple fire tenders were rushed to the spot as a precautionary measure

title: 37 children fall ill after lizard found in midday meal at Kallakurichi school
content: The meal, prepared for 89 children, was served around noon, and a few children complained of nausea and vomiting after consuming it

title: J&K rains: 12,000 km of road length damaged due to floods, landslides
content: Taking note of the damage caused to the Seri-Kath Bridge at Kathua, the deputy chief minister asked NHAI authorities the reason for the bridge collapse in the recent floods despite having been constructed only a few years ago

title: 132 works planned under Comprehensive Road Infrastructure Development Programme in Chennai
content: The works are planned at a combined cost of ‚Çπ561.50 crore, covering 230.68 km of roads across Chennai, Tiruvallur, Kancheepuram, and Chengalpattu districts

title: Madras High Court suspends order appointing one-man commission to probe police excess during Chennai conservancy workers‚Äô protest
content: Justices J. Nisha Banu and S. Sounthar keep the interim order in abeyance pursuant to a petition filed by Greater Chennai Commissioner of Police to vacate the order

title: PM Modi reaches Himachal‚Äôs Kangra after conducting aerial survey of disaster-hit Mandi, Kullu districts
content: After visiting Himachal Pradesh, the Prime Minister will conduct an aerial survey of the flood-affected areas in Punjab

title: Actor Aishwarya Rai urges Delhi High Court to protect publicity, personality rights
content: Senior advocate Sandeep Sethi, appearing for Aishwarya Rai, said the actor seeks to enforce her publicity and personality rights and contended that some completely unreal intimate photographs were being circulated on the internet.

title: Police excess: SHRC recommends compensation to former Madurai Corporation councillor V.K. Gurusamy
content: It also recommended that the State government initiate disciplinary proceedings against the personnel involved in the police excess case

title: TVK founder Vijay demands withdrawal of cases against general secretary, other functionaries
content: In a statement, Mr. Vijay said that the DMK was trying to sabotage the TVK‚Äôs political activities after witnessing the love the party was getting from the people of Tamil Nadu

title: Kancheepuram Principal District Judge remanded DSP over personal dispute with his ex-staffer, police complain to Madras HC
content: Justice N. Sathish Kumar agrees to hear the matter on the same day after Additional Public Prosecutor K.M.D. Muhilan makes startling revelations before the High Court

title: Telangana HC directs TGPSC to re-evaluate Group-I main exam answer sheets; hold exam again if re-evaluation is not completed
content: Justice Namavarapu Rajeshwar Rao of the High Court said the bench would not hesitate to cancel the entire Group-I exam conducted by the TGPSC if its¬†orders were not complied with

title: Brain-eating amoeba: Two children cured of amoebic encephalitis in Kerala
content: The children, aged 12 and seven, respectively, are the siblings of an eight-year-old from Thamarassery, who died of the infection on August 14

title: Kulgam encounter enters second day; two jawans, two terrorists killed so far
content: The encounter erupted after security forces launched a search operation in the Gudar forest area of Kulgam based on specific intelligence about the presence of terrorists, who opened fire on the security forces

title: India asks its nationals in Nepal to exercise caution
content: The Ministry of External Affairs ‚ÄúAs a close friend and neighbour, we hope that all concerned will exercise restraint and address any issues through peaceful means and dialogue‚Äù

title: Financial hiccups, contractor lapses add another year‚Äôs wait for Suchitra-Kompally flyover construction
content: Commuters also said the Bowenpally-Kompally section is the worst affected, with traffic jams that stretch for kilometres during peak hours

title: Rupee rises 14 paise to 87.95 against U.S. dollar in early trade
content: At the interbank foreign exchange market, the rupee opened at 87.98 against the U.S. dollar, then touched 87.95, registering a gain of 14 paise from its previous close.

title: Chamundi Chalo rally foiled, BJP, Hindu Jagaran Vedike supporters taken into preventive custody
content: The rally was organized to protest the Government‚Äôs decision to invite writer Banu Mushtaq to inaugurate Dasara festival slated to be held from September 22 to October 2, 2025

title: Dhankar has maintained uncharacteristic silence, nation waits for him to speak out: Congress
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said that for 50 days now, Mr. Dhankar has maintained an "uncharacteristic silence"

title: Presidential Reference hearing live: ‚ÄúGovernor has no discretion beyond Article 200 option‚Äù
content: Senior Advocate Arvind Datar says the Governor can only grant assent, withhold it, or refer the Bill to the President under Article 200, and nothing more.

title: Personalised Adaptive Learning in A.P. led to better math learning outcomes, finds study
content: Nobel laureate Michael Kremer and his team conducted a trial by giving the PAL software to 30 government schools, and simultaneously studying 30 schools that did not receive PAL intervention

title: 'Won't end well' for India: White House trade advisor Navarro on trade negotiations
content: Mr. Navarro said that the BRICS alliance will not last since the member nations ‚Äúall hate each other‚Äù, and likened their trade practices to ‚Äúvampires‚Äù exploiting the United States.

title: Navy and Mumbai police launch extensive search operation as imposter in Naval uniform flees with rifle, ammunition
content: According to the Defence PRO, the incident occurred on September 6, 2025 night, when a rifle along with ammunition went missing from a sentry post in the Navy‚Äôs residential complex

title: Central University of Rajasthan breaks into top 100 universities in NIRF rankings
content: CUoR Vice-Chancellor Anand Bhalerao said in Jaipur that the university had joined the distinguished league of top higher education institutions as a result of its ‚Äúquality-based education, research, and innovation‚Äù

title: Vice-presidential election LIVE: NDA claims victory while Opposition expects¬†a¬†tight¬†contest
content: C.P. Radhakrishnan, backed by the NDA, holds the edge over INDIA bloc‚Äôs Justice (retd.) B. Sudershan Reddy

title: Bengaluru‚Äôs Blue Line of Namma Metro scheduled for completion by Dec. 2027
content: According to Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited, once completed, the Blue Line will form a 58.19-km uninterrupted corridor connecting Silk Board Junction in the south with the airport in the north via K.R. Pura.¬†

title: West Bengal BJP holds protests over burning of Rabindranath Tagore‚Äôs photograph by TMCP cadres
content: A video posted by several leaders of the BJP on social media showed Trinamool Congress Chattra Parishad students under leadership of Chanchal College president of the student outfit A.B. Soyel¬†attempting to burn a photograph of the poet along with Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah.

title: Supreme Court asks Madhya Pradesh government to pay ‚Çπ25 lakh to convict for over 4 years in jail beyond term
content: Sohan Singh Yadav was only released from Sagar Central Jail on June 6 this year, after advocate Mahfooz A. Nazki wrote to the prison authorities and the M.P. State Legal Services Authority flagging the matter

title: Indian Army PARA (SF) and Indian Navy MARCOS conduct high-altitude combat diving training in Sikkim
content: ‚ÄúTraining in these extreme conditions tests every aspect of a soldier‚Äôs endurance, skill and mental strength,‚Äù the Team Commander said

title: 3 former BJP, AGP MLAs join Congress ahead of Assam Assembly polls
content: Former BJP MLAs Binanda Saikia and Mansingh Rongpi, and AGP MLA Satyabrata Kalita, were inducted into the party in the presence of senior leaders, including Assam Congress chief Gaurav Gogoi

title: Enforcement Directorate raids in several locations in West Bengal, including Kolkata over sand smuggling racket
content: Opposition parties accuse Trinamool Congress of being involved in the racket; TMC officials say these agency raids are a political move before the elections

title: India, China should counter unfair U.S. tariffs: Chinese envoy
content: Xu Feihong said the U.S. is using the tariffs as a kind of ‚Äúweapon‚Äù to extract ‚Äúexorbitant‚Äù costs from various countries, and India and China must cooperate with each other to navigate the situation

title: Maratha quota activist asks government to distribute caste certificate before September 17¬†
content: After Mr. Patil‚Äôs five-day hunger strike in Mumbai, the Maharashtra government issued the GR on September 2, implementing the Hyderabad Gazette to provide Kunbi caste certificates to Marathas of Marathwada

title: After Nizam, successive Congress govts ensured drinking water supply for Hyderabad, says CM Revanth¬†Reddy
content: Foundation laid for Godavari Phase II & III at Gandipet to bring additional 17.5 tmc ft of water to Hyderabad, rejuvenate the Musi river and meet the city‚Äôs rising drinking water needs by 2027

title: Three arrested in alleged honey trap case
content: Police sources said the three had secured ‚Çπ1.45 lakh recently from a youth after¬†luring him into a well-planned honey trap at their rented house at Mavoor

title: The relevance of a robust third political force in Bengal in run-up to Assembly poll
content: There is an urgent need to shift the debate away from communal politics and instead focus on pressing issues, making the third alternative more relevant than ever in West Bengal‚Äôs politics

title: TMC offering me money, ministerial posts to join the party: ISF MLA
content: A TMC MLA came up with an offer for me to join the party¬†and I was arrested on the same day, says Nawsad Siddique; Suvendu questions timing

title: Consumers eager for price cuts to GST-exempt milk-based products
content: While many hope the reduction in cost will make the products affordable for everyone, there has been no information in this regard from Aavin and the private brands so far

title: Kancheepuram DSP remanded in custody for failing to take action in SC/ST Act case
content: High drama unfolded as the¬†DSP did not board his official car to go to the sub-jail, as ordered by the Principal District and Sessions Judge. Instead, accompanied by a few police personnel, he was seen sprinting towards another vehicle. However, half-an-hour later, he emerged in a police vehicle and proceeded to the sub-jail

title: Police not filing FIR against Waqf chairperson over Hazratbal incident, will approach¬†court: PDP
content: PDP and NC parties say that those who took the decision to place the National Emblem on a plaque in a religious place should be held accountable and also demand withdrawal of FIR against locals

title: BJD, BRS, Akali Dal to abstain from vice-presidential election

title: Srushti Fertility Centre case: three government doctors placed under suspension
content: Health Minister feels that the continuation of these doctors in duties might cause hindrance to the investigation

title: Parliamentary panel to be briefed ahead of EU-India FTA talks
content: Officials are expected to help build political consensus over FTA talks with European countries; EU trade negotiators are in Delhi for meetings, where both sides are expected to agree on an accelerated plan for talks every month

title: SC allows Medha Patkar to withdraw plea in defamation case against Delhi L-G

title: Economic practices must be fair, transparent: Jaishankar

title: 111 persons have died in rain-related incidents since April 1
